Key Arguments: The government should not have the power to censor online content.
Censoring misinformation and disinformation is harmful as it drives these views underground.
Governments themselves can be dishonest, and the legislation could be misused to suppress dissent.
A constitutional amendment similar to the American First Amendment is needed to protect freedom of speech.
Notable Quotes: It is never the place of government to be the arbiters of truth and such a concept is simply incompatible with a democracy.
Censoring so called misinformation and disinformation is actually more harmful, because it means those views are driven underground.
This Bill should never have even been conceived, let alone reach draft stage and be actually considered in any serious way.
